data.title: Why is Toronto Called the Six? The Story Behind its Nickname
data.meta_description: Why is Toronto called the six? Discover how this term has evolved into a symbol of unity, diversity, and pride for Torontonians.
data.text:
Have you ever wondered why Toronto, the metropolis in Canada, is often referred to as “The Six”? It’s a nickname that has gained widespread popularity in recent years, especially in the realms of music, sports, and pop culture. But what is the origin of this unique moniker, and why is it so closely associated with the city? Let’s delve into the fascinating story behind why Toronto is called The Six.

Who Started “The Six” Nickname?

Rapper and celebrity Drake is largely credited with popularizing the term “the six” among those outside Toronto, notably through his 2016 album, “Views from the 6.” However, he later shortened the title to simply “Views.”

After the album’s release, many listeners sought to understand the significance of “Views from the 6” and delved into the city’s history for answers.

The Six Represents Toronto’s Area Codes

So, why exactly did Drake choose “The Six” as a nickname for Toronto? The answer lies in the city’s area codes. Toronto is comprised of six primary area codes: 416, 647, 437, 905, 289, and 365. The most well-known of these is 416, which covers the downtown core and was the original area code for the entire city. The other area codes were introduced as Toronto’s population grew and more phone numbers were needed to accommodate the demand.

Drake’s decision to use “The Six” as a nickname for Toronto pays homage to these area codes, symbolizing unity and inclusivity within the city. Regardless of which area code you reside in, if you’re from Toronto, you’re part of The Six.

The Six Represents the Municipalities

The War of 1812 changed of what we now know as Toronto.

These changes persisted until 1967 when the largest seven municipalities were redefined as six. The six included Scarborough, Old Toronto, Etobicoke, East York, North York, and York, the previous name of Toronto.

In 1998, these six municipalities became the beloved Canadian city we know as Toronto today.

The Six Being Embraced by the City

Since Drake popularized the term, “The Six” has been embraced by both residents and visitors alike. It has become a symbol of pride for Torontonians, representing the city’s vibrant culture, diversity, and sense of community. You’ll often hear people referring to themselves as “Sixers” or proudly proclaiming The Six.

The Evolution of the Nickname

While Drake may have popularized the nickname “The Six,” its usage has transcended his influence and become deeply ingrained in Toronto’s identity. Today, you’ll find the term being used in various contexts, from street art and graffiti to local businesses and community events. It has become more than just a nickname; it’s a symbol of the city’s resilience, creativity, and spirit.

Toronto’s Other Nicknames

Aside from its well-known nickname “The Six,” the city has been referred to by various other monikers throughout its history. These alternative names reflect different aspects of the city’s identity and cultural significance.

1. Hogtown

This nickname originated in the late 19th and early 20th centuries when Toronto was a major center for meatpacking and processing. The nickname reflects the city’s association with the pork industry and its role as a hub for livestock trading.

2. T.O.

An abbreviation of “Toronto,” this nickname is commonly used by locals and visitors alike as a shorthand way of referring to the city. It has a casual and familiar tone, often used in conversation and informal settings.

3. The Big Smoke

This nickname dates back to the early 20th century and refers to Toronto’s industrial past and the prevalence of smog in the city. While air quality has improved significantly since then, the nickname persists as a nod to Toronto’s history and urban landscape.

4. The 416

This nickname refers to Toronto’s original area code, which covers the downtown core and surrounding areas. While newer area codes have been introduced as the city’s population has grown, “The 416” remains a nostalgic and enduring symbol of Toronto’s identity.

5. The Centre of the Universe

This tongue-in-cheek nickname reflects Toronto’s status as Canada’s largest city and economic hub. While it’s often used jokingly by residents and critics alike, it also speaks to Toronto’s cultural significance and influence on the national stage.

6. The T-Dot

Another abbreviation of “Toronto,” this nickname is similar to “T.O.” and is often used in hip-hop and urban culture. It has a cool and urban vibe, reflecting diverse and dynamic music scene.

The nickname “The Six” holds a special place in the hearts of Torontonians and has come to symbolize the city’s identity in many ways. Furthermore, originating from the city’s area codes and popularized by rapper Drake, it represents unity, diversity, and inclusivity within the vibrant metropolis of Toronto. So, the next time you find yourself in Toronto, remember to pay homage to The Six – a city like no other.
